required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Crestor on Inflammation of Atherosclerotic Plaques
clinical_study.official_title: Exploratory Study of New Imaging Biomarkers for Measurement of Carotid Plaque Inflammation

brief_summary.textblock: The primary aim of this study is to investigate the effect of 40 mg dose of rosuvastatin on carotid plaque inflammation measured with MRI and PET scanning, to evaluate whether these techniques are promising for future proof of principle studies. A number of patients will receive placebo as a control.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison between the active and the placebo group regarding changes in MRI contrast enhancement in terms of the transfer constant (Ktrans) for the carotid region
primary_outcome.time_frame: MRI scan at enrolment visit and within group after 3 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison between the active and the placebo group regarding changes in MRI contrast enhancement measured as fractional plasma volume (Vp) and changes in 18FDG uptake in terms of standardised uptake value (SUV), respectively
secondary_outcome.time_frame: MRI scan at enrolment visit and within group after 3 months. 18FDG at randomisation visit (baseline) and within group after 3 months treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in carotid MRI contrast enhancement in terms of Ktrans and Vp.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At enrolment visit and within group after 3 months treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in 18FDG uptake in terms of SUV.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At randomisation visit (baseline) and within group after 3 months treatment.

intervention.description: 40 mg, tablet, once daily for 3 months.
40 mg, tablet, once daily for 3 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with a non-calcified plaque of at least 2 mm over an at least 6 mm length on first MR scan with an uptake of contrast agent on the dynamic MRI scan
- Signed written Informed Consent.
- Healthy men 18 - 70 years, women 60 - 70
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of a statin within six months before randomization.
- Use of lipid altering medication other than statins within the last six months.
- Clinical evidence of metabolic or vascular disease requiring statin or other lipid lowering pharmacological or non-pharmacological treatment.
- Total cholesterol > 8, LDL-C > 6 or TG > 6 mmol/L at enrolment

responsible_party.name_title: Björn Carlsson, MD, PhD, Medical Science Director, Discovery Medicine CDT
